subject: RE: [junit] Running Junit tests with several JREs within another test
msgSnippet: Friedhelm, I am surprised that the test runner isn t returning doesn t return. The relevant code in JUnit 3.8.x is: junit.textui.TestRunner: public static void
messageBody:
Friedhelm,

I am surprised that the test runner isn't returning doesn't return. The
relevant code in JUnit 3.8.x is:

junit.textui.TestRunner:
public static void main(String args[]) {
TestRunner aTestRunner= new TestRunner();
try {
TestResult r= aTestRunner.start(args);
if (!r.wasSuccessful())
System.exit(FAILURE_EXIT);
System.exit(SUCCESS_EXIT);
} catch(Exception e) {
System.err.println(e.getMessage());
System.exit(EXCEPTION_EXIT);
}
}

I checked with JUnit 4 and noticed that it doesn't call System.exit(), so
that's something we need to fix.

If you run the tests from the command line, what do you see?

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute
